articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The rapid adoption of artificial intelligence could reduce wages, but so far is creating, not destroying jobs, especially for the young and highly-skilled, research published by the European Central Bank showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: AI threatens wages, not jobs - so far, ECB paper finds

articles.author: Clark Mindock
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday handed 3M (MMM.N), Corteva Inc (CTVA.N) subsidiary E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Co and other manufactures of toxic so-called "forever chemicals" a big win in their fight against legal liability for the substances, rejecting a lower court's ruling that would have allowed about 11.8 million Ohio residents to sue the companies as a group.
articles.title: 3M, DuPont defeat massive class action over forever chemicals

articles.author: Foo Yun Chee
articles.description: Meta Platforms' (META.O) paid no-ads subscription service launched in Europe this month faced one of its biggest tests as advocacy group NOYB on Tuesday filed a complaint with an Austrian regulator, saying that it amounted to paying a fee to ensure privacy.
articles.title: Exclusive: Meta Platforms' paid ad-free service targeted in Austrian privacy complaint

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Alibaba's (9988.HK) cloud service said it suffered a near two-hour long disruption affecting customers in mainland China, Hong Kong and the United States on Monday, its second outage within a month.
articles.title: Alibaba Cloud suffers second service outage in a month

articles.author: Medha Singh, Lisa Mattackal
articles.title: Cryptoverse: 'Layer two' tokens enjoy new life as bitcoin soars

articles.author: Paul Sandle, Sarah Young
articles.description: Rolls-Royce aims to become a much more profitable business with a goal to increase its civil aerospace margin to 15-17% from 2.5% last year, in boss Tufan Erginbilgic's new masterplan for Britain's most prestigious engineering company.
articles.title: Rolls-Royce boss aims for surge in profitability

articles.author: Miho Uranaka, Daniel Leussink, Maki Shiraki
articles.description: Toyota Motor (7203.T) and two affiliates plan to sell about 10% of components maker Denso (6902.T) by year-end, a stake likely worth about $4.7 billion, sources familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Toyota group companies plan $4.7 bln sale of Denso stake -sources

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: An Israel-Hamas truce in Gaza was poised to stretch into a fifth day on Tuesday amid expectations the Islamist group will free more of the hostages it seized on Oct. 7 in return for greater aid flows and Israel's release of imprisoned Palestinians.
articles.title: More Israeli hostages, Palestinians expected to be freed with extended truce

articles.author: Joe Cash, Ellen Zhang, Kane Wu
articles.description: U.S. furniture company head Jordan England thinks his firm's Chinese suppliers are among the best in the game, but geopolitics and a slowing economy have pushed him to source more products from Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe and Mexico.
articles.title: West's de-risking starts to bite China's prospects

articles.author: Josh Smith, Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: After decades of satellite surveillance by foreign governments and analysts, North Korea has sent its first spy satellite on a global orbit with a message to the world: we can watch you too.
articles.title: North Korea says its new spy satellite photographed White House, Pentagon
